intro: Bupleurum jucundum var. cashemiricum, commonly known as Kashmir bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to cold and harsh climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or yellow flowers bloom in clusters. This variant is valued for its potential medicinal properties and is often found in traditional herbal practices.
